result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Gaona

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (26 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 11, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Oscar Gaona in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered case# 14CF1648 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Oscar Gaona in court with attorney Peter J Kovac.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-21-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Attorney for the defendant, Peter Kovac, called the clerk to advise the Court that he has a conflict on his calendar on the 05-15-2014 at 1:30 PM court date and requests an adjournment.  ADA Timothy Cotter does not object.  Case rescheduled to 06-23-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing.  Atty. Kovac to send a confirming letter.

Defendant Oscar Gaona in court with attorney Peter J Kovac.  Defendant Oscar Gaona in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.

Defendant Oscar Gaona in court with attorney Peter J Kovac.  Christopher J Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. cmt  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
14RM021254  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04/18/2014 LJ
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/22/14 @ 1:30pm
